A preterm, LBW infant delivered by LSCS after IVF was put on ventilator in NICU for severe RDS. The respiratory distress subsided on day 7 and TPN with lipid formulation was started from day 10. The neonate developed signs of sepsis on day 15. The most likely causative agent is
All are true about fungus except

options.label: A
options.text: Cell wall of fungus contain chitin, mannan and glucans which are not seen in bacteria

options.label: C
options.text: Sporulation in fungus is for survival as well as reproduction unlike bacteria

questions.correct_answer: D. Sporulation has no diagnostic value

All are asexual spores except

A premature infant born at 24 weeks gestation after IVF had a birth weight of 800 gms. O2 was instituted by head box due to recurrent apnea. TPN was instituted with both amino acid and lipid formulation. After 10 days the baby develops signs of sepsis but blood culture was negative. However blood culture for fungus revealed a fungus with round oval cells and short hyphae. The causative agent is
Dermatophytic infections are characterized by
All are true regarding Id reaction seen in dermatophytes except

options.label: A
options.text: Due to aggressive treatment with terbinafine

options.label: D
options.text: Anthropophilic dermatophyte is more commonly associated than Zoophilic and Geophilic dermatophytes

questions.correct_answer: D. Anthropophilic dermatophyte is more commonly associated than Zoophilic and Geophilic dermatophytes

options.label: A
options.text: Most common risk factor is thorn prick

options.label: C
options.text: Primary pulmonary sporotrichosis is the most common presentation

options.label: D
options.text: Spreads via lymphatic to produce a series of ulcers

questions.correct_answer: C. Primary pulmonary sporotrichosis is the most common presentation

questions.text: A chronically ill young white male is unable to work due to his frequent illnesses. He spends most of his time raising and training pigeons. He develops a mild pulmonary infection and eventually presents to his primary care physician with headache, mental status changes and fever. A clinical diagnosis of meningitis is confirmed with LA test on CSF for capsular polysaccharide Ag of the organism. Which would be the best screening media for this organism for isolation
In Chromoblastomycosis, all are true except

options.label: A
options.text: Dematiceous fungi are the etiological agent

options.label: B
options.text: Hyaline fungi are the etiological agent

questions.correct_answer: B. Hyaline fungi are the etiological agent

questions.text: All are true in eumycetoma except

options.label: A
options.text: Causative agents are hyaline and phaeoid fungi

options.label: B
options.text: Tumour mass is usually single and well defined

options.label: C
options.text: Opening of sinuses are flat and not flared up

questions.correct_answer: D. Less extensive with osteolytic lesions

questions.text: Histoplasma capsulatum, a dimorphic fungus is found in soil heavily contaminated with bird droppings. Which of the following statements best describes the presence of the organism in tissue biopsies
questions.correct_answer: B. Oval budding yeasts inside macrophages

questions.text: All are true about African Histoplasmosis except

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Yeast are larger and thick walled

options.label: C

questions.text: A 10 years old female patient with thalassemia and diabetes is admitted to ICU because of sudden swelling on the right side of the face and an episode of bleeding from the right nostril. She had recently developed signs of ketoacidosis and renal insufficiency. Her blood sugar level at the time of admission is 700 mg/dL. The facial lesion becomes partially necrotic and shows slight protrusion of the right eye and facial paralysis. The patient dies on the second day. Histopathologic examination of the lesions reveals occlusion of the small vessels and the presence of non-septate hyphae. This is most probably caused by which of the following
Aspergillus is best described by

options.label: A
options.text: Round black sporangia filled with endospores, sporangia unbranched, rising from a runner called a stolon from aseptate hyphae

options.label: B
options.text: Thick walled spores with tubercle like projections all around, on septate hyphae

options.label: C
options.text: Widespread in environment, conidia may be inhaled microscopic appearance in specimen reveals dichotomous branching and septate hyphae

options.label: D
options.text: Rosette like cluster of conidia, on conidiophores, arising out of very thin septate hyphae

questions.correct_answer: C. Widespread in environment, conidia may be inhaled microscopic appearance in specimen reveals dichotomous branching and septate hyphae
